sub_title: Founder of WASA: Wool Alliance for Social Agency, Wool March and Wool Mountain Pakistan. Director of Hathaway Designs

profile_positions.description:
Honored to be the Canadian Ambassador for World Hope Forum - Canada Edition, January 22, 2023. The World Hope Forum is an organisation created in Spring 2020 by Lidewij Edelkoort and Philip Fimmano, in collaboration with Dezeen as media partner. The World Hope Forum’s main goal is to create a holistic global platform for the exchange and expansion of knowledge, innovation of business practices, resetting of making methods, invention of alternative models, and the rethinking of rituals for selling, sharing and bartering – as well as other initiatives yet to be discovered. Many themes are on our horizon, such as climate, inclusion, waste management, cooperation, indigenous design, archeology and the humanities to be included in the way we design. We seek ideas about slowing down and scaling down, integrating people and planet in all we do. 

World Hope Forum has showcased designers, artists, philosophers, entrepreneurs, poets, hobbyists, writers, youth organizations, local heroes hand-picked by World Hope Forum Ambassadors from all over the world, including The Netherlands, Ireland, Ukraine, Korea, Japan, Finland, Iceland, Turkey, Brazil, France, USA, Israel, India and Canada.
profile_positions.title: World Hope Forum Ambassador

company.name: Wool Allance for Social Agency, Wool March and Hathaway Designs

profile_positions.company: Wool Allance for Social Agency, Wool March and Hathaway Designs
profile_positions.description:
Cynthia Hathaway is furthering her wool research started at the Sweat(er)shop (Department of Search's Zero Footprint Campus project at the Utrecht Science Park 2016-17). 

The research focuses on communicating wool as not only a sustainable textile source, but a social and interspecies binder, and landscape mobility agent. Hathaway's research consists of promoting a variety of organizations of wool, shepherdry, transhumance (the walking of animals to pasture), migrant associations and rural revitalization. Please see research blog here: woolallianceforsocialagency.blog and @woolmarch on Instagram

WASA is also working with International partners in various nodes of the wool waste stream, particularly in post consumer garment wool waste. Presently, she is co-founder of Wool Mountain Pakistan, and partnered with Hasnain Lilani of Recycle Wool, the largest importer of post consumer sweater waste located in Karachi, and social entrepreneur Gwendolyn Floyd. Together, the first of its kind research lab dedicated to recycling raw and wool waste is being established.

The research is funded with generous support from Creative Industries Fund NL
Wool March is generously supported by DOEN Foundation, Erfgoed Tilburg, Gemeente Tilburg
profile_positions.title: Wool Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Developed a participatory action research program, and a research lab called DISCO*, to determine the theme for the upcoming 2020 Readership at the FHK, Fontys Hogeschool voor de Kunsten, Tilburg. The theme 'Artistic Connective Practices' was developed through a series of community workshops, discussions, lectures, and events with teachers, students and externals, to create a relevant research theme supporting current and future teaching and artistic practice, and a vital head research theme. The research took over a public foyer of the FHK, became a place for artistic researchers to meet each other, and external experts outside of the arts. A community garden was developed with student as an outdoor classroom to practice and test connective practices. Events such as the Potatofest, was a harvesting of the garden and ideas for the future identity of the FHK. 


Together with Studio Renate Boere, the magazine DISCO* – Creating Artistic Connective Practices Through Artistic Research has been developed in order to express the important steps which led to introducing the notion of connectivity as a way of doing artistic research.  *DISCO magazine provides an overview of the different actions Hathaway has implanted during her research and what has (sometimes literally) grown out from it. Highlighting the importance of connectivity and responsibility, the magazine expresses the openness of Hathaway’s research to others, and establishes the importance of participation within artistic research today. Her practice-based research informed the theme and framework for the lectorship-to-be ‘Artistic Connective Practices’ (forthcoming 2020) at FHK, Tilburg.

Contributions: Elise Wortel
Copy Editors: Sophie Krier and Renate Boere
Book Concept and Design: Studio Renate Boere

To order a copy: http://shop.renateboere.nl/product/disco-creating-artistic-connective-practices-through-artistic-research/
profile_positions.title: Artistic Researcher : Artistic Connective Practices

company.name: Department of Search, Utrecht Science Park, Utrecht University

profile_positions.location: Utrecht Science Park, University of Utrecht
profile_positions.company: Department of Search, Utrecht Science Park, Utrecht University
profile_positions.description:
The Department of Search aims to insert artistic thinking and doing to the Utrecht Science Park. The Department of Search is not about Re-Search, but the Search for unknown or "sticky" questions. The Department explores and intervenes in "public" space, creating tangible prototypes in the landscape, whilst also developing a network of scientists, artists and members of the public to consider localized issues surrounding the campus' technological and social sustainability.

Publication 'Department of Search. Where Art and Science create Debatable Futures' available here: 
http://shop.renateboere.nl/product/department-of-search/
profile_positions.title: Co Founder and Artistic Searcher

profile_positions.description:
Co-Director, Masters Department "System D Academy" with Melle Smets. A interdisciplinary artistic research program exploring self organization. The SD Academy aims to bring artistic practice into society and into rational models of formalized thinking. 
The System D Academy is part of the Temporary Masters Program of the Sandberg Institute, a series of 2 year Master courses of specialized research. 
http://sandberg.nl/system-d-academy
profile_positions.title: Co Director of System D Academy at the Sandberg Institute

profile_positions.description:
Exploring a pre-market, newly developed digital printing technology and its applications to architecture and customizing applications for architects, building companies and homeowners. Concept developer of the "Supermaker"; a future plan of city production through 3D printing technology and customization. 
Partner: Oce Canon, The Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Associate Design Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Creative Consultant for the Vier Parmetiers Project, developing a food festival of exclusively grown potato breeds. Experienced during the autumn harvest, this was a celebration of the region and of the organic farmers growing and selling organic potatoes on a international and local scale. Top chef Kees Elfring of Marius and Worst Restaurants directed the menu. Artistic Director Erik Wong continues to place the potatoes in a communication and marketing scheme that uniquely raises consciousness of their value, and has developed successful retail alliances outside of the standard supermarket venue with fashion and design. 
http://www.aardappelfeest.nl
http://www.hutspotamsterdam.com
profile_positions.title: Creative Consultant

profile_positions.description: Heading the Design Research Position: The Sandberg Institute the Masters of the Rietveld Academy, in Amsterdam (Fine Arts, Applied Arts, and Interior Architecture).
profile_positions.title: Design Research
